author: By JEFF AMY and RUSS BYNUM
title: Georgia infections at 5,300 as Kemp readies stay-home order
description: ATLANTA (AP) — Coronavirus infections in Georgia climbed past 5,300 on Thursday, just a month after the state confirmed its first cases, as Gov. Brian Kemp prepared to order residents statewide to shelter at home in hopes of slowing transmission.
content:
ATLANTA (AP) Coronavirus infections in Georgia climbed past 5,300 on Thursday, just a month after the state confirmed its first cases, as Gov. Brian Kemp prepared to order residents statewide to shelter at home in hopes of slowing transmission.
